snippet: No prosecution at all in the case would send a terrible message to the rest of us.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column rejects arguments made by former MF Global executives that they unknowingly plundered segregated customer accounts in their last-ditch efforts to prop up the commodities brokerage firm; contends that prosecutors must redouble their efforts to bring the executives, including Jon Corzine, to trial; holds that failure to do so will increase public cynicism and encourage other executives to steal customer funds.
lead_paragraph: No prosecution at all in the case would send a terrible message to the rest of us.

headline.print_headline: Is MF Global Getting A Free Pass?
headline.seo: Is MF Global Getting a Free Pass?
headline.main: Is MF Global Getting a Free Pass?
